summary: Jakobi Meyers requested a trade from the Raiders, which was denied.

His continued participation may enhance team chemistry ahead of the crucial game.

articles.title: Pete Carroll begins new chapter with Raiders against Patriots
articles.description:
As the NFL's oldest active coach — Carroll turns 74 on Sept. 15 — there certainly is a curiosity about what to expect as he tries to turn around one of the league's most historic franchises.

summary: Pete Carroll, 74, starts coaching the Raiders against the Patriots this season.
Carroll aims to revitalize the Raiders, a historically significant NFL franchise.
Boston fans will closely watch the Patriots' performance against Carroll's new team.

articles.title: Fashion designer Giorgio Armani dead at 91
articles.description:
Starting with an unlined jacket, a simple pair of pants and an urban palette, Armani put Italian ready-to-wear style on the international fashion map in the late 1970s.

The post Fashion designer Giorgio Armani dead at 91 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Fashion designer Giorgio Armani passed away at 91 on September 4, 2025.
Armani revolutionized fashion with his unlined jackets and urban styles in the late 1970s.
His death may influence Boston's fashion community and local retailers that carry high-end brands.

articles.title: Prosecutors spent more than $1.4 million to retry Karen Read, records show
articles.description:
Hank Brennan was paid $566,000, and prosecutors spent more than $850,000 on expert witnesses and other expenses to retry Read.

The post Prosecutors spent more than $1.4 million to retry Karen Read, records show appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Prosecutors allocated over $1.4 million to retry Karen Read in Boston.
Defense attorney Hank Brennan received $566,000 for his services during the retrial.
The high costs raise concerns about resource allocation in Boston's legal system.
